dt: {bc}a division of a baseball game consisting of a turn at bat for each team
{bc}a baseball team's turn at bat ending with the third out

ins.spl: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}a player's turn (as in horseshoes, pool, or croquet)
{bc}a chance or opportunity for action or accomplishment
usually used in plural but singular or plural in construction

dt.t: that momentous {wi}innings{/wi} which was to project him into world politics

shortdef: a division of a baseball game consisting of a turn at bat for each team; also : a baseball team's turn at bat ending with the third out
a division of a cricket match
a player's turn (as in horseshoes, pool, or croquet)

dt: used to say that someone who has died lived a long life

dt.t: We're sad she's gone, but she {it}had a good innings{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that someone who has died lived a long life
